intro: Tephrosia delicatula, commonly known as the delicate tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its small, fragrant flowers are usually pink or white, arranged in clusters, and bloom during the dry season. The leaves are trifoliate, with each leaflet being oval-shaped and slightly hairy.
